definition: thin/to lose weight/(of clothing) tight/(of meat) lean/(of land) unproductive

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The skinny man said he was more polite because he always tipped his hat to ladies.
sentences.chinese: 瘦子說他更有禮貌，因爲他經常對女士摘帽示意。

sentences.english: Therefore, more and more post-natal thin.
sentences.chinese: 所以產後的瘦子越來越多。

sentences.english: The thin feels hurt once touched, whereas the fat is not of afraid of being poked because they have got thick skin.
sentences.chinese: 瘦子被打一下就疼，胖子被戳也不怕，因爲肉厚。

sentences.english: All this talk and no action made Slim impatient.
sentences.chinese: 人們只是談論着，卻不採取行動，這使瘦子耐不住了。

sentences.english: My brother is a thin man.
In the fifth frame there is much water, the sixth grid is of the dumpy son.
sentences.chinese: 第五格大局部是水，第六格則是矮瘦子的土地。

sentences.english: The thin man turned obligingly and called for the slave girl to fetch them food and drink.
sentences.chinese: 瘦子熱情的轉過身叫奴隸女孩給他們拿些食物和酒來。

sentences.english: After the gangsters left, Skinny Zyama picked up the business card and flicked it into his wastebasket.
sentences.chinese: 這倆傢伙走後，瘦子季曼拿起名片丟進他的廢紙簍裏。

sentences.english: Sammi:Of course not, many thin people have high cholesterol too.
sentences.chinese: 當然不會呀，很多瘦子也有膽固醇過高的問題。

sentences.english: He placed the card on Skinny Zyama’s desk.
sentences.chinese: 他把名片放在瘦子季曼的大班臺上。

definition: a person of short stature/a short person
thin/to lose weight/(of clothing) tight/(of meat) lean/(of land) unproductive
back of a tiger and waist of a bear/tough and stocky build
